text: Lee Eun-jeong (; born 1965) is a South Korean police officer currently serving as the 43rd Dean of Central Police Academy since her appointment by President Moon Jae-in in July 2019. She is the first woman to lead the Academy since its foundation in 1980s. She was previously the second woman to become a director- general in the Korean Police Agency equivalent to Senior Superintendent General in 2018 and the fifth woman to become a Superintendent General of the Agency in 2015. She started her career as a police officer in 1988 when she passed the special recruitment exam as an assistant inspector or sergeant. She graduated from Dongguk University majoring in police administration in 1988. == References == Category:1965 births Category:Dongguk University alumni Category:People from Anyang Category:Living people Category:South Korean police officers Category:South Korean government officials
title: Lee Eun-jeong
